info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:51PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Grant County through 215 PM MDT... At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Lake Roberts, moving northwest at 10 mph. Torrential rainfall will occur along NM-15 between Lake Roberts and Silver City. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Roberts, Gila Hot Springs, Pinos Altos, Copperas Vista, Sapillo Creek Valley, Black Canyon Campgrounds, Sapillo Campground, Little Walnut Village, Portions of the Gila Wilderness, Cherry Creek Campground and McMillan Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
